page.title: 18 RETIREMENT IN STRATFORD
page.content: PEOPLE RETIRE TO STRATFORD IN ORDER TO BENEFIT FROM THE MANY AMENITIES. BE- ING A SMALL TOWN,BUILDING SOCIETIES,DE- NTISTS,DOCTORS,CHEMISTS,BANKS ARE ALL WITHIN EASY REACH.THE LIBRARY AND THEA- TRE ARE IN A CENTRAL POSITION AND OLD TOWN IS PARTICULARLY POPULAR WITH THE RETIRED;IT IS A CLOSE-KNIT,FRIENDLY COMMUNITY WITH EASY ACCESS TO THE RIVER ,CHURCH AND GARDEN WALKS.ONE INTERVIEWE WHO HAD ONLY MOVED TO OLD TOWN 2 MONTHS AGO,ALREADY FELT SHE HAD MADE CLOSE, SUPPORTIVE FRIENDS.SHE REMARKED THAT FRIENDS AND RELATIVES FOUND IT EASIER TO VISIT HER IN A TOWN RATHER THAN IN REMOTER AREAS. ELDERLY PEOPLE IN CLIFFORD CHAMBERS AND LUDDINGTON ALSO EXPRESSED GREAT PL- EASURE AT WHERE THEY LIVED,APPRECIATING THE PEACFUL AND ATTRACTIVE OLD VILLAGES BUT THEY SAID IT WAS DIFFICULT TO MAIN- TAIN A LIVELY SOCIAL LIFE.
